experience.title: Graduate Research Assistant
experience.organization: Seattle University Department of Curriculum and Instruction
responsibilities: Conducted a comprehensive longitudinal study on the impact of inquiry-based learning models on high school student retention in STEM subjects.
Analyzed large datasets of standardized test scores to identify correlations between socio-economic factors and academic performance in urban school districts.
Collaborated with faculty to develop and pilot a research-based pedagogical framework for differentiated instruction in secondary education classrooms.
Presented research findings on restorative justice practices in high school environments at regional education conferences.

experience.title: Secondary Education Research Fellow
responsibilities: Led a field research project evaluating the effectiveness of digital literacy integration in 9th-grade English Language Arts curricula.
Authored a technical report on the efficacy of peer-to-peer tutoring models for at-risk youth based on observed classroom interactions.
Assisted in the design of survey instruments used to measure student engagement and psychological safety within the classroom.

metadata.experience_level: Relevant research done for the job field.
